data.event: The territory was claimed in 1665 by the Duke of York.
Renamed New Dartmouth, the plantation was attacked and destroyed in 1676 during King Philip's War.
But it was destroyed again in 1689 during King William's War, and the village was not reoccupied for about 40 years.

event.title: was not reoccupied for about 40 years

data.event: But it was destroyed again in 1689 during King William's War, and the village was not reoccupied for about 40 years.

event.title: 1730, Colonel David Dunbar, the superintendent and governor of the Province of Sagadahoc, resettled

data.event: In 1730, Colonel David Dunbar, the superintendent and governor of the Province of Sagadahoc, resettled it as Newcastle, named in honor of the Duke of Newcastle.
